Reviews.Title: “Not Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cawthorn... Z Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked with easy to book on special deal for 208 euros ended up paying 280 euros!! With only 11 of that being tax!! We got there booked a double bed got 2 single beds!! Then changed our room but key cards didn't work after one night there when we booked 2!! Waiting time in reception was not brilliant either with little understanding reached. The rooms were fantastic & beautiful but other things like bar service & breakfast a real let down! Would not recommend & never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: vsree
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, next to the sloterdijk station. We drove to the hotel, parked the car there and took the sprinter train to Centraal station. For this purpose, I would highly recommend this hotel. Parking is 15euros per day, which is on the higher side. Service was good, room was also good. Breakfast spread is average - nothing remarkable. One thing to note - since the hotel is near the station, it is not your place to take a walk around the hotel or for nice view from the rooms etc.Some rooms may have the problem of train sounds coming into them, but we did not experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express, Sloterdijk”
Reviews.Author: Arun P
Reviews.Content: I was with my wife on pleasure trip to Amsterdam. The hotel location is great, convenient to train station, city center and Airport which is only two stops away. The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. General manager Eric Janssen was very helpful in suggesting some of the worth seeing sites in the area. I would strongly recommend my friends to stay at this hotel and definitely I will stay there too in future.

Reviews.Title: “Security Concerns”
Reviews.Author: Crossingtheglobe
Reviews.Content: Over this isn't a bad hotel for its price, but is it not good neither, I would have give a 2.5 out of 5 if is possible. One of our luggage lock has been broke open during our stay in the hotel and up til today we've yet to hear back from the management in regard of our complains yet. Location: You can call it good or bad. Good: you're only 2 stations away from AMS airport without the need for a transfer. Sloterdijk Station is not only a train station, but also a public transportation interchange with Bus and Tram service that'll take you to different part of the city. Bad: It is pretty far away from most major attraction and getting back to the hotel late at night can be a problem as night buses aren't direct and frequent. Note: take the bus from the hotel if you're going downtown, tram takes twice as much of time and involve a transfer. Purchase a day pass that cost 7.5EURO on bus or tram. Security: Poor. One of our luggage has been broken into with our lock damaged, luckily nothing was missing as nothing valuable was stored in it. The hotel didn't really provide an answer for us nor does it provide any type of compensation or assurance that they'll look into the matter. Rooms are NOT equipped with safety deposit boxes for valuable, if you've something expensive take it to the lobby for them to lock it up for you. But out of our 2 attempts to have something locked in the deposit box at the lobby, none of the attempts were successful, none of their staffs are well trained enough to know how to operate the box! What a joke! Service: 1) Front Desk Lacks Efficiency 2) The front desk missed 2 morning calls in a row, when we call and reconfirm the night before each time. 3) Breakfast is chaotic, at max 2 person is serving a breakfast area with almost 100 people eating. Tables are left uncleaned for ages and have to stood and wait for over 15 mins before somebody comes and cleans it. Food runs out as soon as it arrives on the table and the refill is snail slow. I had 2 bad eggs out of my 3 breakfast there. Cleanliness: Poor, my bathroom wasn't properly cleaned out of all the nights I have stayed in. There are dust balls that form at the corner of my room. Hotel Facilities and Dinning: Free WIFI is available across the hotel but speed is inconsistent, there are a few desktop computer by the front desk that provides internet access. No other facilities that I've used during my stay. The breakfast as I've mentioned is chaotic and terrible. Staffs are rude, tables are uncleaned, food table empty and eggs are bad. Eat else where if you could. Sleep Quality: Although this is a bad enough hotel, sleep quality here isn't bad. Beds are comfortable enough and the aisles are generally quiet. Conclusion: I'd not recommend this hotel unless you've got yourself a great deal. Even that please do take good care of your personal belonging. There are many smaller individually run hotel in the downtown area going for about the same price as this place, try those before trying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very handy location, only a short hop (5 minutes by train) from Central Station”
Reviews.Author: DIANE D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Travelling on motorbikes and hearing about many bike thefts in Amsterdam, finding a hotel with secure parking was paramount for us. We were delighted to find two storey underground locked carpark which was very difficult to get out off, even as paying guests! The hotel and rooms were very clean, breakfast was good and plentiful and service was great. Bedrooms could have done with a bit more storage and shelving. Reception staff, although very helpful, could not find our booking which was a bit of a worry but rooms were availalbe and the price was honoured (after a minor stand-off).

Reviews.Title: “Great for transit travellers!”
Reviews.Author: nikomar
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night, on my way from Brussels. Location is more than good, next to a big station from which you can take frequent train service to Amsterdam's Central Station (5 mins ride) or even to Schiphol Airport (10 mins ride). The hotel is new, rooms are large for European and Amsterdam standards, extremely clean and comfortable. The breakfast is very good, with fresh food and enough varieties. Generally, this could be a great option for tourists and business travellers, namely because of its train connection and frequent services to city centre/ airport. Staff was efficient and polite, I really have nothing negative to say. Finally, this appears to be an excellent value for money hotel for Amsterdam and, Western Europe, generally...

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jlperrino
Reviews.Content: The duvet cover was very hot for spring and all 4 pillows were very big and I got a pain in the neck. In the Service Book provided, they offer blankets and feather pillow. When I asked for them, in the front desk told me they didn't have such articles. I wrote a claim in the email provided in the book but all I got was 'you will receive an answer in the next 14 days'. For me it's a joke. They should improve the communication channel with the General Management. I am still waiting for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GoKoko
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-February with a friend and found it to be an excellent value at 15,000 Priority Club points per night (or just 13,500 per night if you have the Priority Club Visa card!). The staff was friendly and helpful and they maintained the breakfast area very well. Additionally, the bar is nice and the drinks are reasonably priced. I found the rooms to be brand new and wonderful -- especially the bathroom. Great shower and great water pressure. I was also glad they had such a variety of TV channels -- including channels in English. The coffee and tea in the room was also a nice touch. The only negative about this property was the lack of iron and ironing board in each room. They apparently only have one for the entire hotel. This caused some problems for us, as we had just arrived off a flight from Dallas and needed ironed clothing ASAP for a dinner we were attending. I've seen some reviews about the location being poor but I found it to be excellent. It's literally just a 4-5 minute train ride into the Central Train Station which is the stop you want for all of the main Amsterdam attractions. Between all the various means of public transportation, you can get to the city centre in about 10 minutes or less. No biggie at all. Overall, a great spot and will definitely stay again when visiting Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good deal, could be more if...”
Reviews.Author: dooandherb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located directly next to the Amsterdam Sloterdijk train station. It is a 5 min walk to the front entrance whhich located near the bus plaza. It takes about 10 min by train to get to Amsterdam Centraal or Schiphol by train, and these trains run every 5 to 10 minutes. (Schiphol is 3,20 euro 1 way for an adult or 2,50 for a road runner ticket child up through age 11) As mentioned before the (double) automatic doors can be a bit annoying and yes the elevators are not that big. However there are 2 of them. Check in was quick and efficient, room was ready. The room was clean and was serviced during the day that we were gone, we had no issues with cleanliness during our stay. The window opens (tilts in) and if you are facing the trainstation, with the window open, yes you will have noise. There are individual room controls on the wall. Wifi was available and free and was quick enough. The room had 2 single double size beds I believe, they were relatively comfortable with 2 pillows each. Flat screen tv with plenty of channels. There is no inroom safe, however the front desk has safes available. The shower was clean (good size), with 2 big towels and 1 smaller one, no wash cloth. Body wash/shampoo/soap all in one dispenser are located near the sink and in the shower. The shower and room were well contructed with no issues. The hotel is new and it shows. There is no onsite restaurant. The front desk has a menu. They do not deliver and are only open till 10pm. So I recommend to have eaten or have some food with you if you arrive after 9.30 pm. There is no fridge or microwave in the room. There is the inroom water heater with instant coffee and tea. We did not have breakfast, did have a drink at the bar downstairs. Prices were decent. Issues: - the tv was still set to Winter time, and I could not change it. - I asked for a wake up call and never received it!!!! it could be more if...... If they work on the overall service a bit. I would give this hotel a 4 instead of a 3. The hotel is new and clean, the rates are good and the location is convenient. There just are the inconsistencies between the service received. Once that is worked out it would be a lot better. Let me know if you have any questions. So in short, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “not a great location”
Reviews.Author: effesdrinker
Reviews.Content: hotel was nice and new however you are right by the train & bus station and you can hear the noise in your room and there is nowhere to have a walk round only a small place to eat that isn't open on the weekends. some staff were nicer than others . The cleaner for our rooms on the sixth floor was useless ,not once did he make the beds ,he never hoovered there were bits on the carpet when we arrived an they were still there when we left(5 nights) also it says to put towels on floor if you want them to be changed we didn't need them changed so left them on towel rail but everyday he changed them and one day he forgot to replace them ,,also in the corridor there were crushed crisps on the day of arrival theses were also ther when we left. ! All in all he was useless.The breakfast was nice and fresh each morning it was a shame there wasn't a restaurant for an evening meal although they will order food in for you. The entrance to the hotel is a bit of a pain as you have to go through one lot of doors and let them close before next set open this is ridiculous especially when a coach load of people arrive,the lifts are supposedly being updated they need to be .Didn't feel security was very good anyone could get into one of the lifts and go to whatever floor they wanted without being seen by any member of staff as the reception is 2 floors up in fact i think anyone could go in for the free breakfast and no one would know . All in all the hotel was nice enough but location wasn't great its more for business people although it only takes 10 minutes on bus 48 Borneo Eiland to get to Central staion then two minutes walk into the square.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location considering Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: steve375
Reviews.Content: New HI Express. At the Sloterdijk rail station. No restaurant for lunch or dinner. Not even in walking distance on Sunday. You have to get back on the train to find a place to eat. Should not have opened until in complete working order. The elevators don't operate properly. No in room movies. I will never stay here again. If you are looking for a reasonably priced HI near the airport, stay at the HI Express Hoofdoorp.

Reviews.Title: “Not at per with other HIE properties..”
Reviews.Author: SidofNCR
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night in March 12. Location: good connections but out of the main city. Comfort: I was given a corner room on 3rd floor. It was a small and congested room. The railway station was just below the hotel and rooms are noisy. The worst part was no hot water in the tap on day two morning, at least for 5-6 hours. Every time I got the answer that that was a major fault in the hotel so, no hot water anywhere in the hotel...and someone is coming to fix it within next 10-15 mins.............NOT ACCEPTABLE

Reviews.Title: “dont go there”
Reviews.Author: territraveller1000
Reviews.Content: 1. is out in the middle of nowhere, you need a train or 45 minute tram/bus ride to get to town 2. unlike fairmont montreal where you are over trains but can sleep, this is over, beside, and next to trains, 24/7... we were on 5th floor, corner to be as far away as possible, but still noisy 3. water was cold most of the time, temperature would vary during shower, manager very defensive, well rude, about our concerns about this 4. televsision signal didnt work, internet was limited 5. it is not a new hotel as they advertise, it is renovated 'orly hotel' as the sign outside indicates 6. i had prepaid, so couldnt leave, but they tried to charge me again anyway

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: QX11
Reviews.Content: It is a great base to explore Amsterdam. The rooms are clean . The staff also speak good English and is able to help us with our queries on attractions in Amsterdam. The breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Alteria D
Reviews.Content: We apent many hours viewing hotels in Amsterdam centre, thinking about quality of sleep/noise disturbance etc but a very good deal on the web made the decision for us and we were pleasantly surprised. Atlhough we couldn't turn the AC off we got used to the gentle hum( seems to be in all hotels now) and there was no noise from the street or other guests i.e good insulation. Breakfast was good including a variety of cereals, cold meats, cheese and fruit though you had to watch what you picked as some other guests would pick up rolls and then put them back. (As happens in every hotel - I've no idea how people can do that knowing others are going to eat the food.). Very easy access to the centre as the hotel is right next to the station. Return fare was under 4 Euros The reception and catering staff were very helpful We would stay there again. People with mobility problems should make sure they access the hotel via the low-level floor of the station as that is the same level as the entrance to the hotel. Make sure you eat in the centre as there were no restaurants open nearby.though.....there was a kiosk/bar which was closed. Tip for management-please ensure there is a plentiful supply of rolls being baked when at breakfast time and consider extra staff at peak times for breakfast. The only waitress was in and out of kitchen refilling dishes, trays and jugs of milk. We felt sorry for her as she was obviously overworked and doing her best, yet smiling all the time. Guess this means though you may have to wait a few minutes the food is always fresh though. The Housekeeper spoke in a derogatory manner to 2 chambermaids in front of us.......there was no need for that manner or tone to be used. We felt sorry for them that they had to work for her.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hazel C
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip combined with a leisure break. Hotel just 2 train stops from the Airport in the direction of Amsterdam Central and just 1 stop from Amsterdam central. From Sloterdijk station you can get to almost anywere by train, bus or metro. Asked the hotel and was give a room on the 5th floor facing away from the station so no complaints re noise. Staff very friendlyand accomodating. Rooms a nice size and very clean and modern. Bathroom had a double sizes shower cubicle. Continental breakfast a good selection of cereals, meats, bread, ham, cheese, croisants etc. Very good value for money, especially with breakfast included and a lot of hotels in Amsterdam city did not include breakfast and charged an extra 15-20 Euros per person for breakfast. Down side not much to do in the vacinity of the hotel, but only a 10 minute train ride from Amsterdam central and trains run virtually 24/7 and about every 10 minutes. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: E.M.E V Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. Clean room and bathroom. The beds slept very well. Breakfast not extensive but of good quality. Nice people at the reception. Nearby the trainstation. Every 5 minutes a train to the Central Station of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “New Amsterdam HI Express”
Reviews.Author: Diemel
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam has its own HI Express. Out of center location. But right next to Sloterdijkstation. Easy quick train service to/from airport. From Sloterdijk less than 10 min to central station Amsterdam. Hotel was a former officebuilding but renovated to a fresh, stylish design. Only the elevators have to be renovated yet.

Reviews.Title: “Booking incorrect”
Reviews.Author: Gerald A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booking was incorrect, had booked 3 rooms but the hotel only had 1 room booked for us,confusion of payment by the staff, had to wait for 6 minutes for a drink at the bar due to lack of eye contact was told to make my "presents" when i wanted to be served. Wifi is a problem in the hotel.Clean rooms and comfortable beds,good breakfast and the staff in general very pleasant.Situated next to the train station takes 5 mins ride to central station .

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iain_Mac52
Reviews.Content: Brand spanking new. First impressions were great, very modern in reception and really throughout the hotel. Staff were very welcoming and helpful with directions etc. Not really anything to fault. For future travellers best way into city centre is the train, which is literally just round the corner. We didn't experience any noise polution at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellor
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here with our granddaughter and my sister in law for 4 nights. it was easy to get to - direct train ride from Schiphol airport (10 mins). The staff at the Hotel were wonderful and nothing was too much trouble, with all of them speaking English very well. The Hotel was clean, bright and modern and the complimentary Continental breakfast was very good - it was varied and constanly replenished. It is one train stop from Amsterdam Centraal (5 mins), the cost of which was about 4.5 euros return.This Hotel has only been open for a couple of months having been converted from an office block, but don't let that put you off as it looks and feels like a quality Hotel. There is a small bar and a very comfortable lounge area. Wi-fi is free and the Hotel even supplies a couple of terminals for guests to use, again free of charge. Whilst out of the main city of Amsterdam, I would highly recommend it as transport is extremely regular (train, tram and bus)

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, still some bugs, but unbeatable for price and location”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: Pros: location, next to train station Sloterdijk, one stop from Central Station. price (under 100 euros), free breakfast (very basic, but ok), completely new, stylish furniture, flat screen cons: bad cleaning service (don't really clean the room, just tidy it), entrance is at -2 floor - annoying and not good for when you have a heavy suitcase as you need to take it down lots of stairs, roomkey needs to be reset frequently, cold eggs at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: curban17
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was Great! I'm not sure what di_raf was talking about because I thought the breakfast selections were great. If you want a full-service, hot breakfast, you should stay at a full service hotel! I especially like the lobby bar where you can unwind and have a couple of drinks at the end of the day. Very convenient location right next to the train station. Only took a couple of minutes to get anywhere in the city because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: di_raf
Reviews.Content: Ok, it is near the tram station which takes you to the center in 15-20', the reception is very polite but the breakfast sucks! Although I stayed there three nights and I went for breakfast in three different hours , I never managed to find something descent to eat. For me they are below the average. Breakfast is number 1 priority!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel 1 stop away from Amsterdam central”
Reviews.Author: TravelWorkAndPlay
Reviews.Content: Great stay, fantastic staff, clean rooms, very comfortable, we spent our days sightseeing walking the canals and soaking up the atmosphere around dam square, then back to hotel in the evening, sooo comfortable beds! Great sleep, help yourself breakfast, served until 11am. Has Free WiFi, T.V's, coffee/tea hairdryer,in rooms / towels changed daily. bar and lounge area, car parking under hotel. Definitely will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Merci H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convinient and acceable and hostpitable and the staff very friendly. Its more like home! I will defenitly be back! The rooms where very comfortable and with others guest i share the opinion that this is a great hotel. Very clean too!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Vera044
Reviews.Content: Next to the station, very easy to get to Amsterdam and to the airport. Clean rooms, large, breakfast was OK. Some problems with the warm water, which won't mantain the temperature.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam-Sloterdijk Station
HotelInfo.Address: Zaventemweg 3, Amsterdam 1043 EH, The Netherlands
